definition: Ming Dynasty (1368-1644)/surname Ming/Ming (c. 2000 BC), fourth of the legendary Flame Emperors, 炎帝[Yan2 di4] descended from Shennong 神農|神农[Shen2 nong2] Farmer God
bright/opposite: dark 暗[an4]/(of meaning) clear/to understand/next/public or open/wise/generic term for a sacrifice to the gods
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: In America, it's in our Constitution.
sentences.chinese: 在美国，宪法有明文规定。

sentences.english: The act expressly provides for injunctive relief.
sentences.chinese: 该法令明文规定了强制令救济。

sentences.english: Budget Law of China makes it clear, that local government is not permitted to issue public debts.
sentences.chinese: 我国《预算法》明文规定，不允许地方政府发行公债。

sentences.english: This company stipulate that all of its employees work eight-hour days.
sentences.chinese: 公司明文规定员工一天上班八小时。

sentences.english: This article was revealed generally the spoliation of evidence in civil litigation by the educational world.
sentences.chinese: 该条文被学界普遍认为是证明妨碍制度的明文规定。

sentences.english: The act expressly provides for injunctive relief.
sentences.chinese: 该法律明文规定了强制令救济。

sentences.english: Our country's law of criminal procedure lacks the regulations to the system.
sentences.chinese: 我国刑事诉讼法对刑事缺席审判制度缺乏明文规定。

sentences.english: In the modern times, although national laws have ruled the labourers'right of rest, it is difficult to ad- minister.
sentences.chinese: 劳动者有休息的权利，这是我国宪法中明文规定的。

sentences.english: It is proclaimed in writing here to forbid selling of pornographic books.
sentences.chinese: 这里明文规定，禁止贩卖黄书。

sentences.english: Many news organizations have written policies regarding the use of anonymous sources.
sentences.chinese: 许多新闻机构对使用匿名来源有明文规定。

sentences.english: The supplier shall define and document how the requirements for quality shall be met.
sentences.chinese: 制造业者应明文规定如何达成质量要求。
而且这是在宪法中明文规定的。

sentences.english: But there were Senate rules in place designed to prevent that kind of irresponsibility.
sentences.chinese: 但是参议院有明文规定，来阻止那种不负责任的行为。

definition: provision/to fix/to set/to formulate/to stipulate/to provide/regulation/rule/CL:個|个[ge4]
to state in writing (laws, rules etc)
to comply with/to abide by/to respect (an agreement)
according to provisions/as stipulated in the rules
to issue/to proclaim/to enact (laws, decrees etc)
